sentence.Network_en: She says the artist's impression is an excellent likeness of her abductor.
sentence.Network_cn: 她说这张模拟画像像极了绑架她的人。

sentence.Network_en: He felt a sharp pain in the abductor muscle in his right thigh.
sentence.Network_cn: 他感到右大腿外展肌一阵剧痛。

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent. (as a term in anatomy): modern Latin (see abduct)

entry.def: If someone is abducted by another person, he or she is taken away illegally, usually using force.

example.ex: His car was held up and he was abducted by four gunmen...
example.tran: 他的车遭遇拦劫，随后他被4名持枪歹徒劫持。

example.ex: She was charged with abducting a six-month-old child.
example.tran: 她被控诱拐一个6个月大的孩子。

means.word_mean: 1. someone who unlawfully seizes and detains a victim (usually for ransom)
2. a muscle that draws a part away from the median line

auth_sentence.content: He was going to find his daughter and murder her abductor.
auth_sentence.res_content: He was going to find his daughter and murder her abductor.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He was going to find his daughter and murder her abductor.

auth_sentence.content: He has suffered abductor and calf muscles since then but recently returned to club action.
auth_sentence.res_content: He has suffered abductor and calf muscles since then but recently returned to club action.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He has suffered abductor and calf muscles since then but recently returned to club action.

sentences.en: His wife has appealed to his abductors to release him.
sentences.cn: 他妻子请求绑架者释放他。
